name: ReLIVe Responder: Cardiac Arrest
description:
Over 350,000 incidents of Out-of-Hospital Cardiac Arrest occur every year. Are you prepared? Practice responding to cardiac arrest so you aren’t caught off guard. Play ReLIVe Responder!

Emergency situations are hectic and scary if you are unsure of what to do, and sometimes CPR means the difference between life and death. Any help that a cardiac arrest victim can get before EMS arrives can increase the chances of survival.

-ReLIVe Responder: Cardiac Arrest will help prepare players to:
-Recognize cardiac arrest
-Know to call 911
-Communicate concise, condition-specific info to 911 dispatch
-Understand the basics of hands-only CPR
-Know how to transfer care to EMS and disengage 911 dispatch

This app was developed by ReLIVe, the University of Pittsburgh Resuscitation Logistics and Informatics Venture, a project funded with generous support from the Henry L. Hillman Foundation, and based in the University of Pittsburgh Department of Emergency Medicine. For more information about all of ReLIVe’s projects, visit www.pittrelive.org.

Disclaimer: ReLIVe Responder: Cardiac Arrest is designed to inform the player of the importance of responding to cardiac arrest and communicating concise, condition-specific information to 911 dispatch. This app does not replace formal CPR training. The game recognizes the player’s in game performance and has no merit upon real life aptitude. For more information about responding to cardiac arrest, visit: www.pittrelive.org
